intro: Adenocarpus intermedius var. tazzekanus, commonly known as the Tazzekan adenocarpus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and small, compound leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or green, and it produces small, lens-shaped fruits. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with limited water availability.
